title: Defence Force (United Nations Peacekeeping Operations) (Emoluments) Regulations, 2022
content:
4th November, 2022 Statutory Instruments 951
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 70 OF 2022
The Defence Act
(Laws, Volume 16, Cap. 287)
The Defence Force (United Nations Peacekeeping
Operations) (Emoluments) Regulations, 2022
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section 210 of the Defence
Act, the following Regulations are made:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Defence Force Title
(United Nations Peacekeeping Operations) (Emoluments)
Regulations, 2022
2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires— Interpretation
“ contingent” means a group of soldiers and officers representing
the Defence Force of the Republic, as part of a military
force joining another Defence Force outside the Republic;
“contingent owned equipment” mens major or minor equipment,
and consumables deployed and operated by a contingent
in the performance of peacekeeping operations; and
“reimbursement” means a sum of money paid to the Republic
by the United Nations to recover money that is spent or
lost by the Republic for providing contingent owned
equipment personnel and self-sustainment support services
to a contingent in a peacekeeping operation.
3. (1) A reimbursement to the Republic shall be retained by Reimbursement
the Defence Force.
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O. Box 30136, 10101 Lusaka. Price K4.00 each.
952 Statutory Instruments 4th November, 2022
(2) Despite subregulation (1), a reimbursement received for
providing personnel shall be disbursed to each deployed officer
and soldier at a rate of one hundred percent
